primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals His righteousness in Jesus Christ to helpless sinners, replacing human effort with divine indwelling.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is at work in you
Christ is the end of the law
He has already implanted himself within our hearts
the righteousness that comes from God
the joy of your eternal kingdom
given to us by God in Jesus Christ
While we were still helpless, Christ died for the ungodly
Help of the helpless, O abide with me
indwelling us by the power of the Holy Spirit
seeking to establish their own righteousness
the great god of bureaucratic process
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the fundamental human drive to replace God's grace with self-justification, which leads to spiritual death/stumbling.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer lives out the righteousness already received through the indwelling Christ.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (empowered by Christ)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Actions on behalf of the poor / Reconciliation / Recovery
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (grace).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is at work in you
Jesus Christ brings the religious law to an end
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We seek to establish our own
People don’t quote from the Bible the way they used to

voorbeelden: Behave yourself! (cited as the false gospel)
What I want more than anything to communicate
Being ignorant of the righteousness that comes from God
His power is with us in the running
indwelling us by the power of the Holy Spirit

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) provided by God because the human Subject is 'helpless' (lacking competence).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (The lady's 'Work out your salvation') to ~S1 (Self-help/Moralism) to ~S2 (Helplessness) and finally to S1 (The Joy of the Gospel).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in Christ as the 'telos' (end/goal) of the law.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the law is presented as a crushing weight if not fulfilled by Christ.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon systematically deconstructs moralism and reposition's God as the sole active Subject of salvation.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is at work in you, both to will and to do

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Israel) are used as warnings of failure, not models of virtue.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Israel (as a negative example of self-help)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God justifies the ungodly Gentiles.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and liberation from the 'job' of religion.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (God works in the believer).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfectly integrates the primary program of salvation with the secondary program of living.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Work out' and 'God works in' is resolved grammatically and theologically.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ is the end of the law... indwelling us by the power of the Holy Spirit.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the law demands but cannot give.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It identifies the human tendency to usurp the Subject role and corrects it through semiotic reversal.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify with the 'archetypal WASP' in a way that leads to shame.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'Joy' of being the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; the context of Lent justifies this focus.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (self-righteousness) is already treated as a lethal stumbling block.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon brilliantly exposes the 'grammar of moralism' and replaces it with a 'grammar of grace' where God remains the active Subject from start to finish.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would look at the anecdotes, Greimas shows how the anecdotes function as actantial mirrors of the theological core.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of 'telos' to show how 'telos' changes the functional role of the Law from Opponent to internal Helper.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'typo' (Joy vs Job) is actually a semiotic shift in the Object of the narrative.

appendices.notities: The sermon specifically targets the 'Subject-switch' error common in American Christianity.
